Text: Fortunately, you're not going to need a significantly large enclosure for the gargoyle gecko. While it's possible to house them in a 10-gallon tank, a larger reptile vivarium (aim for at least 12x12x12) is recommended. Either glass or plastic will assist with humidity retention, and you may want to look for a front-facing door and vents.

Gargoyle geckos can benefit from some form of light during the day, which will help regulate their day/night cycle as well as improve appetite, activity, and overall health. Aim to have their light on for about 12 hours a day.
